text: Siegfried (or Sigfried) ( â€“ 28 October 998) was count in the Ardennes, and is known in European historiography as founder and first ruler of the Castle of Luxembourg in 963 AD, and ancestor and predecessor of the future counts and dukes of Luxembourg.Michel Pauly, Geschichte Luxemburgs p. 27 He was also an advocate of the abbeys of St. Maximin in Trier and Saint Willibrord in Echternach. ==References== Category:10th-century births Category:10th-century deaths Category:Luxembourgian monarchs Category:History of Luxembourg
title: Siegfried of Luxembourg
